data.title: ReFi Medellín - First Colombian Node of ReFiDAO responsible for promoting ReFi projects in Medellín.
data.description:
# We are the movement towards a more sustainable and equitable future in #Medellín.
[refimedellin.org](https://www.refimedellin.org/es)

## ReFi Medellin has $GloDollar integrated in the new lending platform to help people reach Financial Inclusion through Credits Without Collateral and at a low interest rate.

## ReFi Medellín was the first local node to integrate $GloDollar in the Treasury and now holds 60% of the Treasury in GloDollar. [Check the GloDollar Announcement](https://x.com/glodollar/status/1717542327735181450)

The goal of the node is to nurture community conversations around Web3 enabled regenerative-oriented-innovations (ROIs) and empower the youth in Medellín to address some of our city's most pressing challenges through hackathons, incubation, and investment. These challenges include poverty, inequality, youth unemployment, and a general lack of access to resource flows such as energy, water, sanitation, housing, and education.

## Team
[Juan Giraldo](https://linktr.ee/juanjgiraldoc), [Tereza Bizkova](https://www.linkedin.com/in/tereza-bizkova/), [Ximena Monclou](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ximenamonclou/), [0xflypeztic](https://twitter.com/0xflypeztic), [Edward](https://twitter.com/Tiranicida), [Green Digital Guardians](https://dgguardians.com/) y [Dotlabs()!](https://dotlabs.academy/)

## Brief explanation of this project:
With this project we will develop the ReFi understanding and with it we will improve the environmental and social impact that new ventures can have in the Region, creating a new focus for ReFi projects and understanding, helping us to grow economically without destroying our environment and our lives in the process. We also work hand in hand with ReFiDAO helping to onboard more people into the ReFi environment.

## Objective for this funding: 
We want to carry out onboarding activities so that more people learn about the ReFi movement and focus their projects on this path and philosophy.

With greater awareness of the existence of this type of projects and technologies, we are sure that they will add very well to the city's trend of new technology-based ventures, progressively creating a boom in ReFi companies in the region with global impact.

We believe that through ReFi Medellín, we can create a more socially inclusive and ecologically regenerative urbanism. Your support will enable us to make a significant impact on the lives of young people in our community, and we appreciate your donation.

## Learn more
* [Webpage](https://www.refimedellin.org/es)
* [LinkTree](https://linktr.ee/refimedellin)
* [Instagram](https://x.com/refimedellin)
* [X](https://x.com/refimedellin)
* [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/refimedellin)
* [Telegram Community](https://t.me/refimedellin)
* [Lu.ma Calendar](https://lu.ma/refimedellinpublic)
data.problem: Medellín faces significant challenges including poverty, inequality, youth unemployment, and limited access to essential resources such as energy, water, sanitation, housing, and education. These issues hinder financial inclusion and economic growth, especially for the youth, who lack opportunities to participate in the economy meaningfully.
data.solution: ReFi Medellín integrates $GloDollar in its new lending platform to provide credits without collateral and at low interest rates. By increasing liquidity with the funds received from grants, ReFi Medellín ensures stable and sufficient access to USDGLO, enabling more users to take loans. This financial inclusion initiative empowers individuals and communities to overcome economic barriers, fostering sustainable development and growth.
data.missionSummary: ReFi Medellín aims to create a more sustainable and equitable future in Medellín by nurturing community conversations around Web3 enabled regenerative-oriented innovations (ROIs). Through hackathons, incubation, and investment, the project empowers the youth to tackle pressing city challenges. The integration of $GloDollar in the lending platform supports financial inclusion by providing accessible credits, while promoting environmental and social impact. ReFi Medellín collaborates with ReFiDAO to onboard more people into the ReFi environment, striving for a socially inclusive and ecologically regenerative urbanism.
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

data.title: Glo Dollar x Arbitrum DAO
data.description: We’re rallying all Web3 projects to start embedding philanthropy in their organization by integrating the Glo Dollar stablecoin in their platform and/or treasury. By doing so these organizations bring three benefits to the world: (1) directly contribute to funding basic incomes for people in extreme poverty, (2) spread the word about Glo Dollar to a bigger audience, indirectly growing basic income funding, and (3) opportunity to join the Glo Consortium to further collaborate on reducing extreme poverty. Glo Dollar is collaborating with Arbitrum DAO to bring a total of $10,000 in USDGLO in matching for organizations that embed philanthropy. Whether you're already part of the Glo Consortium or looking to dive into Glo, this round is for you.

Increase the liquidity of USDGLO on the Celo blockchain within our lending platform using the funds received from the grant. The goal is to ensure stable and sufficient access to USDGLO for lending and borrowing activities, enabling more users to obtain loans. This will enhance transaction efficiency, improve user experience, and foster growth and stability in our platform.
data.title: Add more Liquidity in USDGLO in Celo to our Lending Platform

data.name: $EARTH
data.description: $EARTH - Digital currency backed by real world climate solutions, ecosystem services and solarpunk values

**Description**
We are the movement towards a more sustainable and equitable future in #Medellín.
refimedellin.org

The goal of the node is to nurture community conversations around Web3 enabled regenerative-oriented-innovations (ROIs) and empower the youth in Medellín to address some of our city's most pressing challenges through hackathons, incubation, and investment. These challenges include poverty, inequality, youth unemployment, and a general lack of access to resource flows such as energy, water, sanitation, housing, and education.

**Team**
Juan, Tereza Bizkova, Ximena Monclou, 0xflypeztic, Edward.

**Brief explanation of this project**
With this project we will develop the ReFi understanding and with it we will improve the environmental and social impact that new ventures can have in the Region, creating a new focus for ReFi projects and understanding, helping us to grow economically without destroying our environment and our lives in the process. We also work hand in hand with ReFiDAO helping to onboard more people into the ReFi environment.

**Objective**
We want to keep our path we have build during the last year since ReFiMedellin Inception that have allowed us to promote ReFi culture and among that we have fostered the conservation of green areas inside the city and nearby.

We constantly do onboarding activities an more people learn about the ReFi movement and focus their projects on this path and philosophy.

We have build a path of some activities that toghether help us to create community and work for the ecosystem.

- Impact Onboarding Activities
    - Planting Activities
    - Urban Gardening
    - Health, Sport and Wellness Activities
    - Social collaborations with local NGOs
    - Educational Activities
- Incubate ReFi Regional Projects
- Lending Platform
    - For microcredits without collateral based in reputation systems integratin USDGLO.

With greater awareness of the existence of this type of projects and technologies, we are sure that they will add very well to the city's trend of new technology-based ventures, progressively creating a boom in ReFi companies in the region with global impact.

We believe that through ReFi Medellín, we can create a more socially inclusive and ecologically regenerative urbanism. Your support will enable us to make a significant impact on the lives of young people in our community, and we appreciate your donation.

**Learn More**
* [Webpage](https://www.refimedellin.org/es)
* [LinkTree](https://linktr.ee/refimedellin)
* [Instagram](https://x.com/refimedellin)
* [X](https://x.com/refimedellin)
* [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/refimedellin)
* [Telegram Community](https://t.me/reficolombia/211)
* [Lu.ma Calendar](https://lu.ma/refimedellinpublic)

questions.query: How should the success of your grant be measured?
questions.explanation: Number of people onboarded, number of loans taken, number of wallets opened.

questions.query: What is the intended direct impact your project will have on the ecosystem?
What is the long-term impact of your grant?
How will the grant funds be used?
questions.explanation: Grants funds will be used to add more liquidity in USDGLO in Celo to our lending platform.

questions.query: What is the timeframe for the work funded?
How will receiving a grant enable you to foster growth or innovation within the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: It provides us liquidity to keep doing our activities.

data.description: Increase the liquidity of USDGLO on the Celo blockchain within our lending platform using the funds received from the grant. The goal is to ensure stable and sufficient access to USDGLO for lending and borrowing activities, enabling more users to obtain loans. This will enhance transaction efficiency, improve user experience, and foster growth and stability in our platform.
data.title: Add more Liquidity in USDGLO in Celo to our Lending Platform

data.name: Celo Public Goods
data.description: Celo is scaling Ethereum with real-world solutions, leading a thriving new digital economy for all

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation: We have been Onboarding People into Celo Ecosystem since our Inception, our focus is always Celo, we also have a Validator registered in ReFiColombia Validator Group and we also have the lending protocol with big liquidity in USDGLO in Celo.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation: Our key goals for this year include **expanding our lending platform** with **collateral-free microcredits** (USDGLO & cCOP), **growing our ReFi education programs** through workshops and English Sessions, and **strengthening regenerative urbanism** via community gardening and social impact projects. We aim to **increase financial inclusion**, **develop reputation-based lending**, and **foster local ReFi entrepreneurship**, creating a more sustainable and equitable Medellín. 🚀

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.
